issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Any problem in getting aggregated logs for rendering on web ui, then LogReader is not closed. 

Now, it reader is not closed which causing many connections in close_wait state.

hadoopuser@hadoopuser:> jps
*27909* JobHistoryServer

DataNode port is 50010. When greped with DataNode port, many connections are in CLOSE_WAIT from JHS.
hadoopuser@hadoopuser:> netstat -tanlp |grep 50010
tcp        0      0 10.18.40.48:50010       0.0.0.0:*               LISTEN      21453/java          
tcp        1      0 10.18.40.48:20596       10.18.40.48:50010       CLOSE_WAIT  *27909*/java          
tcp        1      0 10.18.40.48:19667       10.18.40.152:50010      CLOSE_WAIT  *27909*/java          
tcp        1      0 10.18.40.48:20593       10.18.40.48:50010       CLOSE_WAIT  *27909*/java          
tcp        1      0 10.18.40.48:12290       10.18.40.48:50010       CLOSE_WAIT  *27909*/java          
tcp        1      0 10.18.40.48:19662       10.18.40.152:50010      CLOSE_WAIT  *27909*/java
fields.summary: Potential file handle leak in aggregated logs web ui

comments.body: Uploading a patch for closing reader in case of IOException for rendering aggregated logs.
Nice catch!  Moving this to Patch Available so Jenkins can comment on the patch.

This message is automatically generated.
+1 lgtm, will commit this shortly.  I noticed this affects 0.23 as well.
Reader.close() calls BCFile.Reader.close() which. Isn't doing anything. Am I missing something?

I think the logic behind calling close on the TFile.Reader is consistency -- if an object has a close() method, probably prudent to call as it may not always do nothing in the future.

The real fix with this patch is in AggregatedLogsBlock which will call close() on the LogReader which will in turn close the data stream and release the associated socket.

I see, tx for the clarification.

There are atleast two or more other abrupt returns in the render() method that need to handle the same.

Also we can use IOUtils.cleanup(Log log, java.io.Closeable... closeables) for closing the reader.

Thank you Vinod Kumar Vavilapalli and Jason Lowe for reviewing patch :-)

I have addressed Vinode comments and attached updated patch. Please review updated patch.
Handled clean up during reader creation.Previous patch misses this clean up.

Please ignore YARN-1145.1.patch.

All the comments has been fixed in YARN-1145.2.patch. Please consider this patch for review.
Moving to Patch Available so Jenkins can comment

This message is automatically generated.
The {{finally}} blocks are always closing the reader, even in the unexceptional cases.  That's leading to NPEs as shown in the Jenkins test reports.
Modified the patch for closing the streams only on "return" from render method.
Moving to patch available so Hadoop QA can comment.

This message is automatically generated.

Looked at the patch. Thougth I'll do some final cleanup myself that I wanted, but there were a little too many and I wanted us to address a few more issues. So cancelling the patch for some quick comments:
 - We don't use tabs, instead use two spaces. Both the changed files have a tab each
 - Also use standard formatting. The indenting is wrong, no spaces after commas etc.
 - Not related to your patch, but let's make LogReader and LogWriter closeable. Rename LogWriter.closeWriter() to be close()
 - At which point, you won't need AggregatedLogsBlock.closeReader(). Use IOUtils.cleanup() everywhere
 - There are still a few places that are missing the close(). For e.g, +149, 162 etc. I think the better approach is to remove these individual close() calls altogether and put the whole render() method in a try {} finally {} block and then call close() in the finally block.

{color:green}+1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12612346/YARN-1145.4.patch
  against trunk revision .

[~jlowe], please merge it into 0.23 if you would like it to be.
